result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T Forseth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

Cases 21CF1361, 21CF1891 and 22CM39 are dismissed and read in

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Jordan T Forseth in court, in custody.  Attorney Kyle E Jesinski in court for Jordan T Forseth.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
State files information.  
Defense accepts receipt of the information and enters plea of not guilty. 
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant and goes over waiver of right to preliminary hearing. 
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. 
The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant.  
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Case 21CF1361, 21CF1891 and 22CM39. 

Court orders the following:
WITHHELD
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jordan T Forseth in court, in custody.  Attorney Kyle E Jesinski in court for Jordan T Forseth. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Jesinski states he has received a global offer in these matters.  
Atty Jesinski does request a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
